info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 12:32PM CDT until May 9 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Amarillo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Canadian River at Amarillo 19N affecting Potter County.
For the Canadian River...including Amarillo 19N...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Canadian River at Amarillo 19N.
* WHEN...Until Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Dirt road that runs east alongside the river channel becomes flooded. This road leads to Rosita Creek Flats Recreation Area, where primitive camping occurs.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 9.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 9.0 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening to 2.9 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 06/24/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 115 AM CDT.
